Frostee Rucker.Outcome: Pleaded no contest to vandalism and false imprisonment, three years of probation, 750 hours of community service.

Brian Griese.Description: Pulled over for speeding near Denver, accused of drunk driving, failing sobriety tests.
Brian Griese.Outcome: Pleaded guilty, one year of probation.

Ryan Krause.Description: Pulled over in Pacific Beach neighborhood of San Diego around 2 a.m., accused of drunken driving.
Ryan Krause.Outcome: Pleaded guilty, volunteer service of 32 ours, $1,756 in fines and costs.

Keith Hamilton.Description: Pulled over for window-tint violation, accused of cocaine and marijuana possession.
Keith Hamilton.Outcome: Pleaded guilty to cocaine possession, three years of probation, 1,000 community service, retired from NFL.

Kenny Wright.Description: Accused of evading arrest by trying to outrun police in Texas, misdemeanor marijuana possession.
Kenny Wright.Outcome: Resolution undetermined. Cut by team a month after arrest.

Kenny Wright.Description: Pulled over for speeding in Texas, charged with misdemeanor marijuana possession.

Michael Turner.Description: Charged with drunk driving just hours after scoring a touchdown in a win against Denver on Monday night.

Prince Shembo.Description: Accused of killing ex-girlfriend's Yorkie dog, which showed extensive injuries. Charged with felony aggravated animal cruelty.
Prince Shembo.Outcome: Resolution undetermined. Released by team same day.

Darren Perry.Description: Accused of drunk driving, hit-and-run and rear-ending another car near New Orleans. Police pursued him after seeing him swerving in traffic.

Chad Rinehart.Description: Charged after police in Cedar Falls, Iowa, say he was pulling on the locked door outside a bar and refused a breath test.
Chad Rinehart.Outcome: Found guilty by a judge, paid $195 fine

Darren Hambrick.Description: Accused of felony grand theft after he cashed a $5,682 check from the Carolina Panthers, then said he never received it and cashed the reissued check.
Darren Hambrick.Outcome: Pleaded no contest, 20 hours of community service, one year of probation.

Ross Verba.Description: Pulled over for speeding in Wisconsin, he was arrested on warrant for writing bad checks in Las Vegas.

Cliff Crosby.Description: Accused of screaming and swearing at police in Erie, Pa., after being stuck in traffic.
Cliff Crosby.Outcome: Pleaded guilty to disorderly conduct, $125.50 in costs, 25 hours of community service.

Charles Grant.Description: One of several men charged in connection to shooting death of innocent pregnant woman, a bystander at club fight in Georgia.
Charles Grant.Outcome: Pleaded to reduce charge of affray (public fighting), $20,000 restitution, $1,000 fine, probation.

Ronyell Whitaker.Description: Accused of not appearing in court for previous reckless driving incident even though his attorney was there. Police later apologized.

Ko Simpson.Description: Accused of hindering police in Rock Hill, S.C., when one of his friends was being arrested at bar. Police said Simpson proclaimed he was "worth millions."
Ko Simpson.Outcome: Diversion program, at least 50 hours of community service.

John Capel.Description: Pulled over in Florida, accused of misdemeanor possession less than 20 grams of marijuana.
John Capel.Outcome: Diversion program. Team waived rights to him in July.

Shaun Phillips.Description: Cited for misdemeanor battery after a security guard at a San Diego hotel said Phillips punched him.
Shaun Phillips.Outcome: Never charged. Civil settlement with guard.

Shaun Phillips.Description: Accused of obstructing police after an officer said he saw him pull a woman's head back by her hair in downtown San Diego.

Moe Williams.Description: One of four Vikings accused of taking part in "love boat" ride on Lake Minnetonka with naked dancers and sex acts, disorderly and lewd conduct.
Moe Williams.Outcome: Found guilty of disorderly conduct, 30 hours community service, $300 fine.

Lionel Dalton.Description: Accused of domestic battery in incident with his wife on Thanksgiving.
Lionel Dalton.Outcome: Charged dropped when she did not testify.

Terry Johnson.Description: Pulled over in Arizona for going 40 mph in a 25-mph zone, accused of being impaired "to the slightest degree."
Terry Johnson.Outcome: Charge dropped after blood-alcohol content measured 0.72. Team released him three days after arrest.

Terry Johnson.Description: In police raid, police found six unregistered guns, which they said violated his previous probation stemming from a previous gun charge.
Terry Johnson.Outcome: Guilty of probation violation, served two months in jail, $2,500 fine. Suspended by NFL.

Terry Johnson.Description: Accused of aggravated assault, threatening police and resisting arrest at nightclub in Chicago.
Police found a loaded 9mm gun in his car he was driving outside a nightclub.
Terry Johnson.Outcome: Pleaded guilty to gun charge, $2,500 fine, 18 months of probation, 40 hours of community service.

Quinton Carter.Description: Accused of felony cheating at craps in North Las Vegas casino. He allegedly placed $5 chips on table after dice rolled.

Ty Law.Description: Police tried to stop his Rolls-Royce for a lane violation in Miami before he sped away.

Chris McAlister.Description: Accused of drunk driving in Northern Virginia, forcing him to miss team practice.
Chris McAlister.Outcome: Charge dropped for lack of evidence.

Chris McAlister.Description: Accused of disturbing the peace, verbal abuse and pushing a flight attendant in dispute over seating arrangments at Las Vegas airport.
Accused of marijuana possession after authorities found small amounts in his house while investigating a burglary.
Chris McAlister.Outcome: Charge dropped for lack of evidence.

Antwon Blake.Description: Accused of being drunk in public in Oceanside, Calif.

Daren Stone.Description: Suspected of drunk driving in downtown Atlanta.

Jon Beason.Description: Accused of aggravated assault after a confrontation with a man in Charlotte strip club.

Rod Coleman.Description: Pulled over for speeding in DeKalb, Ga., accused of getting irritated at police and asking, "Do you know who I am? I play for the Falcons."
Rod Coleman.Outcome: Pleaded no contest to disorderly conduct, $1,000 fine, six months of probation.

Will Billingsley.Description: Charged with assault and nonviolently resisting arrest after argument over shoes with his girlfriend, who was found with scratches on her upper arm and neck.
Will Billingsley.Outcome: Case dropped after girlfriend said she wouldn't pursue it. Cut by team two months later.

Kenoy Kennedy.Description: Pulled over in suburban Detroit, accused of drunken driving. Blood-alcohol content measured at .16.
Kenoy Kennedy.Outcome: Pleaded guilty, 18 months probation, alcohol treatment, five days community service.

Cletis Gordon.Description: Pulled over in San Diego after game against Oakland Raiders, accused of drunken driving.
Cletis Gordon.Outcome: Charge dropped after blood-alcohol content measured below legal limit.

Dwayne Carswell.Description: Accused of choking and biting his girlfriend outside a nightclub in Atlanta and also obstructing police.
Dwayne Carswell.Outcome: Pleaded guilty to batter, one year of probation, one-game NFL suspension.

Dwayne Carswell.Description: Accused of pulling a woman's hair and bruising her arm's in altercation in Pueblo, Colo.

Anthony Waters.Description: Charged with simple assault after allegedly striking a fellow motorist who threw a rock at his windshield and broke it.

Justin Miller.Description: Accused of third-degree assault after swinging at a man but hitting a woman instead at New York nightclub.

Dorian Green-Beckham.Description: Pulled over for speeding in Missouri, where officer found an outstanding warrant for previous unpaid speeding ticket.

Robert Quinn.Description: Charged with driving while intoxicated and two other traffic charges.

Chris Naeole.Description: Accused of getting into a shoving match with employees at a bar in Jacksonville Beach, he was subdued by police using a Taser.

Dwayne Jarrett.Description: Pulled over for speeding after 2 a.m. and arrested on suspicion of driving under the influence.
Dwayne Jarrett.Outcome: Resolution undetermined. Cut by team same day of arrest.

Dwayne Jarrett.Description: Police say he ran a red light and crossed center line, accused of drunken driving with blood-alcohol content of 0.12 near Charlotte.
Dwayne Jarrett.Outcome: Pleaded guilty, surrended license, 24 hours of community service, $420 in court costs.

Lorenzo Taliaferro.Description: Accused of destroying a taxi cab window in Virginia, being drunk in public.
Lorenzo Taliaferro.Outcome: Diversion program. Charges to be dropped if he pays for damages, has clean record.

Mike Rumph.Description: Pulled over after police said he ran stop signs in his Escalade, accused of drunk driving in Miami.

Dominic Rhodes.Description: Pulled over for speeding, Rhodes was accused of operating a vehicle while intoxicated in Indiana.
Dominic Rhodes.Outcome: Pleaded guilty to reduced charge of reckless driving, $1,000 fine, two days in jail.

Dominic Rhodes.Description: Accused of hitting and shoving his live-in girlfriend in Indiana.
Dominic Rhodes.Outcome: Diversion program, $150 fee, counseling and treatment.

Jimmy Smith.Description: Pulled over for speeding in Jacksonville, accused of drunk driving. Tests later showed cocained in his system. Blood-alcohol measured below limit at .05.
Accused of refusing to obey police orders during incident at a bar in Maryland. Smith said he was trying to help an intoxicated woman.

Quincy Wilson.Description: Accused of failing to heed police order to disperse from bar, where he was part of a wedding party in West Virginia.
Quincy Wilson.Outcome: Charge dropped in exchange for staying out of trouble through Dec. 17.

Lionel Gates.Description: Accused of hitting pregnant woman in argument about whether he was father of her child.
Lionel Gates.Outcome: Diversion program, anger management course, $3,200 in restitution.

Jason Snelling.Description: Pulled over for traffic violation, accused of marijuana possession of less than one ounce, no registration.

Michael Boley.Description: Accused of becoming physical with wife during argument at home in Dacula, Ga.
Michael Boley.Outcome: Diversion program. NFL suspension of one game.

Darnay Scott.Description: Accused of writing a back check for more than $5,100 to a motorcycle shop in Florence, Ky.
Darnay Scott.Outcome: Charge dropped, but he spent a night in jail and had to pay back the money.

Aqib Taliq.Description: Police near Dallas issued warrant accusing him of firing gun near head of sister's boyfriend.

Cedrick Wilson.Description: Accused of punching ex-girlfriend in the face, disorderly conduct at restaurant.
Cedrick Wilson.Outcome: Diversion program, anger counseling. Released by team the next day.

Juqua Parker.Description: Pulled over for a traffic violation in Bethlehem, Pa., accused of marijuana possession as passenger in the car.
Juqua Parker.Outcome: Charges dropped after district attorney said the officer had no right to search the car.

Derreck Robinson.Description: Accused of drunken driving after police heard single-car crash into center divider on interstate highway near La Mesa, Calif.
Derreck Robinson.Outcome: Guilty, six-month suspended sentence, five years of probation, $1,850 fine.

Kaluka Maiava.Description: Accused of beating two men at a bar in Maui along with his brother.
Kaluka Maiava.Outcome: Pleaded no contest, 15 days in jail.

Albert Connell.Description: Accused of taking $3,500 from car of teammate Deuce McAllister and $863 from his locker. He claimed it was a prank.
Albert Connell.Outcome: Charge dropped after he returend the money, and McAllister declined to press charges. Team released him Feb. 28

Lance Briggs.Description: Accused of crashing his Lamborghini into pole and leaving the scene of the accident. His car was discovered around 3:15 a.m.
Lance Briggs.Outcome: Pleaded guilty, one year court supervision, 120 hours community service.

Leon Searcy.Description: Accused of kicking his wife in the leg during an argument.

Justin Durant.Description: Police said they found him in his car on road, charged him with possession of open container and resisting arrest.
Justin Durant.Outcome: PENALTY FOR CRIME? Suspended two games.

Ray Rice.Description: Accused of striking his wife at Atlantic City casino, rendering her unconscious. She also is accused of hitting him.
Ray Rice.Outcome: Diversion program. Two-game suspension, then indefinite suspension, cut by team.

Da'Rick Rogers.Description: Pulled over for swerving in Indianapolis, suspected of drunken driving.
Da'Rick Rogers.Outcome: Resolution undetermined. Team cut him later that day.

Keelan Johnson.Description: Accused of striking police officer, disordery conduct during disturbance at a bar in Tempe, Ariz.

Shaun Rogers.Description: Charged at Cleveland Hopkins International Airport on felony count for carrying a handgun in his carry-on bag.
Shaun Rogers.Outcome: Diversion program of 12 months, 10-hour weapons course, 40 hours community service, NFL fine.

Tremain Mack.Description: Sentenced to a month in jail for probation violation stemming from previous drunk-driving conviction. A TV station filmed him driving, which violated probation.

Thomas Keiser.Description: Accused of getting into a fight with another man outside a bar in downtown San Diego after Chargers' game.
Thomas Keiser.Outcome: Pleaded guilty to misdemeanor battery, required to take anger management classses.

Vincent Jackson.Description: Pulled over for playing loud music, cited for driving with a suspended license and expired tags.
Vincent Jackson.Outcome: Pleaded guilty to knowingly driving with suspended license , 80 hours community service, fined under $1,000.

Vincent Jackson.Description: Pulled over for speeding and weaving, failed sobriety tests in San Diego, accused of drunken driving in 2008 GMC Sierra.
Vincent Jackson.Outcome: Sentenced to four days in jail and five years of probation

Vincent Jackson.Description: Pulled over in San Diego, charged with drunk driving. Blood-alcohol measured at .13.
Vincent Jackson.Outcome: Pleaded guilty, $1,750, five years of probation.

Donte Nicholson.Description: Scuffled with security guards at bar, shot with stun gun, accused of resisting arrest and battery.
